results.title: Prolactin Response to Metformin in Cabergoline-Resistant Prolactinomas: A Pilot Study.
results.text_hl: However, 10-20% of @DISEASE_Prolactinoma @DISEASE_MESH:D015175 @@@prolactinomas@@@ are resistant to @CHEMICAL_Cabergoline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077465 @@@cabergoline@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, a @CHEMICAL_Biguanides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001645 @@@biguanide@@@ widely used in the treatment of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@, has been shown to reduce @GENE_PRL @GENE_5617 @@@prolactin@@@ secretion in various @<m>DISEASE_Pituitary_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010911 @@@pituitary tumor@@@-cell lineages both in vitro and in vivo and in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Pituitary_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010911 @@@pituitary adenomas@@@ in vitro.

citations.NLM: Portari LHC, Correa-Silva SR, Abucham J. Prolactin Response to Metformin in Cabergoline-Resistant Prolactinomas: A Pilot Study. Neuroendocrinology. 2022;112(1):68-73. PMID: 33477154
